result.heading: EXT./INT.
location: FLOWER SHOP -- DAY 2 A YOUNG MAN

direction.raw_text: constructed like an ampitheater: the buyers sit in a steeply raked semi-circle, facing two giant, clock-shaped scoreboards that display the bids on the flowers being viewed. The striped tulips fetch a very high price. 1D   The carts of striped tulips are delivered to an automated 1D sorting apparatus of enormous size and complexity. They end up on a truck heading for the airport. 1E   The tulips are loaded onto a plane. During the transatlantic flight, they sit nestled in the cargo hold. 1F   The tulips are unloaded from the plane, driven across an    1F airport tarmac and loaded onto another plane. 1G   The tulips are unloaded from the plane and loaded onto a   1G truck. The truck drives through a small town and pulls into the back of a 2    EXT./INT. FLOWER SHOP -- DAY                                2 A YOUNG MAN takes delivery of the flowers and carries them through the rear of the store to the display area up front. We stay on the tulips as we hear the following conversation:

direction.raw_text: Let's discuss, briefly and to begin, with the category of "thieves", as distinguished from the larger category of what might be termed "hardened" criminals. direction.raw_text: ? 66   INT. EUROPOL HEADQUARTERS -- LONG SHOT -- DAY                66 Isabel and Hess walk briskly through the ultra-modern hallway. He briefs her as they walk in a hushed voice. Then something he says stops her in her tracks. Hess continues to explain something we can't hear. Then he pulls out some PHOTOS. Isabel leafs through them. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 66   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's impossible! 67   EXT. VANDERSPEIGLE HOUSE -- CRIME SCENE -- DAY             67 Isabel arrives and is greeted by PAUL, a lead detective working the Vanderspeigle theft for the Amsterdam police department.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for coming. We can really use your help on this one. His partner looks over at Isabel, who is wearing a skirt and pretty damn good shoes. The guy checks out her legs and looks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope the scene hasn't been contaminated. Isabel walks away. Moments later, she enters the house with the lead detective. 68   INT. VANDERSPEIGLE HOUSE - DAY                             68 As soon as she's inside she's all business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No forced entry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not that we can find. 69   UPSTAIRS -- VANDERSPEIGLE'S HOME OFFICE                    69 Isabel looks around Vanderspeigle's home office.   Behind a fake bookcase is a small room which contains the safe. In the other direction is Vanderspeigle's bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nods) We can't figure out how they disabled the alarm. We thought maybe they tried to short it out somehow. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 69   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, that would have triggered the system. Isabel goes to the alarm pad. Pulls the face plate off, examines the inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And damaged the circuits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, then I don't know how they got in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They had to have known the code. She moves on to look in the mark's BEDROOM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calls to her) We considered that, but the mark swears that nobody in the world knew the code except him. He programmed the last seven steps of the system himself. He set it and never left the house again. When he dies, we'll probably have to physically cut all the power lines to the house to get it off line. Isabel examines the computer brain of the alarm system which was locked inside a titanium case in Vanderspeigle's bedroom closet. She answers the detective almost as an afterthought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are other ways to get the code. (to herself) Closed loop. Redundant servers. Titanium encasement. Not bad. The lead detective enters the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what? Again, Isabel is inside her own mind. She's really just answering the detective's questions out of courtesy. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 69   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh...well, they probably set up in a house across the canal and watched him type the code in through a pair of binoculars. We GO WITH HIM as he walks back into the office. He stands at the alarm panel and pretends to type in the code. He twists around and looks out the window behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling to Isabel in the bedroom) Actually, I don't know about that. Isabel re-enters the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless he had a habit of typing in the code like this-- He stands to the side of the panel and reaches over to type in the numbers. It's an obviously unnatural position. Then he moves in front of the panel and types in the code as one normally would.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --then his body would block the view from across the canal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why they probably set up over there-- She points out an adjacent window on another wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --And used the mirror. She points at a small mirror on the opposite wall. The detective bends down so his eye is at the level of the keypad, then he looks in the mirror. He can see directly across the canal into another house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm guessing they'd need a fifteen hundred millimeter lens to get a clear shot but-- But Isabel's already moved on. Something has caught her attention just above the alarm panel: a patch of paint that is shinier than the paint that surrounds it. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 69   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? Isabel uses the blunt end of a letter opener from Vanderspeigle's desk to gently dig at the wall under the paint. The plaster there is soft and wet. In fact it isn't plaster at all. It's spackle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is that? Isabel cooks her head again. 72   MIND'S EYE (ISABEL) -- THE NIGHT BEFORE                    72 THUNK!   A crossbow bolt hits the wall above the alarm panel. 73   BACK TO SCENE -- THE CRIME SCENE                           73 ISABEL It's where the crossbow bolt hit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A crossbow bolt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever heard of Franz Schuman?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 73   CONTINUED:                                                    73 Isabel is at the window. The one that Vanderspeigle leaves cracked open every night. Isabel looks across the canal at the apartment where Basher and Saul were playing cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They would have fired from that roof. Through this open window. Isabel kneels down, checks the line-of-sight to make sure she's correct.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From that roof, through this window? Nobody could make a shot like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a cop, anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that supposed to mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. Your friend downstairs put me in a bad mood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's an idiot. You shouldn't let him bother you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. You're right. Isabel pulls out a notepad and writes the name: "Eugene `Basher' Tarr." There are two names above Basher's in her little book: "Robert Ryan" and "Danny Ocean."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But these man are exceptionally good. Even when they make mistakes. 74   MIND'S EYE (ISABEL) -- THE NIGHT BEFORE                      74 A bolt flies through Vanderspeigle's open window and hits the wall above the alarm pad. Two thin wires are attached to a tiny wheel, which is attached to the back of the bolt. The wires run back to the window of the apartment across the canal. Inside that apartment: the wires end in another tiny wheel which is mounted on a large tripod for stability. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 74   CONTINUED:                                                      74 In effect the group now has a mini-clothesline running between the alarm pad and the apartment across the canal. Livingston attaches a device designed to fit directly over the number pad of Vanderspeigle's keypad to the "clothesline" that runs across the canal. 75   BACK TO SCENE -- THE CRIME SCENE                               75 Isabel writes: "Livingston Dell?" Underneath Basher's name in her notebook. 76   MIND'S EYE (ISABEL) -- THE NIGHT BEFORE                        76 Livingston's device is shuttled across the canal, through Vanderspeigle's cracked window and right to the alarm panel. Magnets on the side of the device cause it to snap into place over the top of the keypad.   Livingston then types a six- digit code into a remote keypad. His keypunches are mimicked by the remote device. Vanderspeigle's alarm shuts off. Downstairs: From inside we see the front door lock picked. The door swings open. 77   BACK TO SCENE -- THE CRIME SCENE                               77 Isabel nods her head. There's a slight smile on her face. The smile of admiration, respect in another's skills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did he get up and notice the certificate was gone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The alarm woke him at 4:2O am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the alarm would have been-- She stops.    And smiles to herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... Oh, I know what happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Isabel quickly glances around the room.       Her eye lands on the floor near the false bookcase. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 77   CONTINUED:                                                   77 On some dark lines in the crevices where the floor boards meet.   She kneels down for a closer look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was someone else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone else. 78   MIND'S EYE (ISABEL) -- THE NIGHT BEFORE                     78 Danny and Rusty come through the front door. They are followed by Linus. All of them are soaking wet from 24 hours in the swamp under the house, and the last few minutes in the pouring rain outside the front door. The group silently slips up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I wish I could've have seen that. 79   INT. VANDERSPEIGLE OFFICE - NIGHT                           79 They enter Vanderspeigle's office. You can hear him snoring in the other room. Danny and Rusty quickly, carefully remove the crossbow bolt from the wall and take it to the window. They drop it (and the attached wires) to the Malloys, who are waiting on the street below. Meanwhile Linus spackles the hole in the wall and paints over the spackle. Danny and Rusty turn to see that Linus is finished. They hand-signal each other like Special Forces guys do, then move towards the bookcase on the adjacent wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That must have really been something. Suddenly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait!   Wait! Shhhh! Everyone freezes. Danny puts his hand up to his ear to try to listen for the sound he thought he heard. We hear the faint sound of somebody singing to themselves. Danny and Rusty quickly realize it's coming from behind the bookcase. What the hell? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 79   CONTINUED:                                                      79 They yank open the false bookcase to reveal a handsome Frenchman who has just finished cleaning out the contents of Vanderspeigle's safe. Danny and Rusty stare at him.   He turns around and sees them, but if he's bothered in the slightest he sure isn't showing it. Danny approaches him. This exchange is whispered with a great amount of drama at very close range.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. What the hell are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am getting here first. Just then, Frank and Yen arrive.    The Frenchman looks them over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is our score.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am here before you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (joining) We let you in the house! Somehow you got in after we hit the code but before we got to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's thirty seconds. How could I know which exact thirty seconds I had? Unless I knew you plan. Could I have known your plan? Do you have a snitch in your group?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I know you don't. Because I saw, the whole thing from that chair. I knew you were around, but I had my own plan. Yen says something in Chinese. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 79   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's really no need for that. Danny wants to raise his voice, but he can't.   Vanderspeigle is snoring twenty feet away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, we have to come to some arrangement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've incurred some very serious costs here. Danny and Rusty look at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we have. The Malloys arrive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every second I am becoming more outnumbered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispering, re: Dinner Jacket) Who's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said he got here first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's bullshit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is our goddamned job! He sounds as angry as a guy who's whispering can sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If the situation were reversed--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the situation is not reversed. The situation is that I am here first, without any help from you. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 79   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So as much as I would-- Basher and Saul arrive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, how many of you are there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just give us the stock certificate. Whatever else you took out of that safe...it's yours. Dinner Jacket stops.   Thinks for a moment.   Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. But: I leave you with something. He hands Danny a business card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My attorney. In case Evelyn's employer tries anything...well, anything. Dinner Jacket smiles, then pulls a tiny electronic device out of his shirt pocket. He presses a button. And the alarm blares to life. 80   BACK TO SCENE -- THE CRIME SCENE                              80 Paul stares at Isabel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure there's another scenario that would fit these physical details, but I don't know what it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where should we start? Isabel takes out her PDA, writes something on her keypad, and hits a few buttons. A second later, Paul's BEEPER goes off. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: . 80   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can start by picking that guy up. 81   INT. AMSTERDAM HOTEL SUITE -- DAY                       81 The group sits around looking depressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who the hell was that guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's going to get out, you know. People are going to find out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody must know this bloke's name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The question is who trained him. He got into that place alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believed him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (unsettled) You think he's better than us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not saying anything, but the man was sitting there, waiting for us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think the cops even know who this guys is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. That guy's never even seen a cop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he works with the cops. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 81   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't work with the cops unless you absolutely have to. And not even then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Either way, he's got to have a name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It can't be that hard to find out who this guy is. Like I said, somebody trained him. Who trains the best?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: LeMarc. (to Rusty) Right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he's not dead.

POLICE HEADQUARTERS -- DAY                           82 Isabel arrives. 83   INT. POLICE HEADQUARTERS -- DAY                           83 Isabel is waiting to be processed. Eventually, she is directed down a hallway. 84   INT. INTERROGATION ANTEROOM -- DAY                        84 We LOOK through a one-way mirror into the interrogation room where detectives Onderdonk and Devenpeck are trying the bad cop / bad cop routine on Evelyn. Isabel walks INTO FRAME and watches: Onderdonk slams his fist on the table. Davenpeck shouts in Evelyn's face. Evelyn just laughs. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 84   CONTINUED:                                                    84 Isabel shakes her head. Frustrated and more exhausted than their detainee, the two detectives leave the interrogation room for the ante-room where Isabel is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fucking stone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not quitting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who said quitting. I'm tired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I speak to him? The two detectives look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you? Isabel produces a signed document. They look at it, shrug, and give it back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apparently, you can do whatever you want with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you moving him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no. I just need to speak with him. To get some information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've been on him for six hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With our best stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our best stuff. In mind terms, we've been torturing this guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure. I only need a moment, then I'll be out of your way. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not a problem, it's a hiccup. It won't affect our schedule that much. I want to talk about you, not the job. How are you doing? KNOCK-KNOCK-KNOCK. Something about it doesn't sound familiar. Danny moves into the big roam. Rusty is at the door, looking through the peep-hole. Rusty puts his head down. Clearly it isn't a stranger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tess, I've got to call you back. He hangs up. KNOCK-KNOCK-KNOCK. Rusty indicates for Danny to get it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming. Danny opens the door to reveal ISABEL. She looks at Danny. He looks back at her. They don't say a word. Danny motions for her to come in. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 85   CONTINUED:                                                   85 RUSTY (still glued to the TV) Who is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Rusty) Hello, Robert. Rusty spins to see Isabel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabel. He crosses to her.    STAY with the group for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Robert?"    Is that his real name? Virgil and Turk shrug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How does she know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ex-girlfriend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fiancee. 86   ANGLE ON RUSTY AND ISABEL                                   86 The entire group is watching them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's great to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it? Because you've been seeing a lot of me lately. She hands a surveillance photo to Rusty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were sitting in a Mercedes outside my apartment on Wednesday night. She hands Rusty another photo. (These are the photos Hess the male secretary showed her at Europol HQ that we couldn't see.) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 86   CONTINUED:                                                   86 ISABEL You were hiding in the bushes when I had lunch yesterday at Trattoria Bella. She hands him a third photo.   Looks at the fourth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This one...I'm not even sure where this one was taken, but I like it a lot. Very Ron Gallela. She hands this photo to Danny. It's a picture of Rusty, with a dorky look on his face, peering out from behind a mailbox he's using as cover while he spies on Isabel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, if I didn't know better I'd think you all came here to steal the Vanderspeigle Getuigschrift, also known as the world's first stock certificate. (to the group as a whole) You must have been so proud of yourselves. A Schuman Special. It's been awhile. (smiles at Basher) That was a very handsome crossbow shot, Eugene. Basher winces at the sound of his real name. The group stares back at her. Can't believe this is happening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the Palowski...whose idea was that? She knows it was Rusty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We didn't steal anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh...I know you didn't. Somebody beat you to it. One man. No crew. No back up. Tell me something -- just so I can get the full picture in my head -- was he wearing a tuxedo? A white dinner jacket? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 86   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Isabel) At least we saw him in the flesh. You'll never see this guy your whole life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you know who he is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course we know who he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, then. I'll see you when you see him. To get your certificate back. She takes the photo of Rusty peeking from behind the mailbox from Danny's hand. She walks out. The group is frozen. Livingston is still looking at the pictures of Rusty following Isabel.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did she-- That was--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Rusty) This is what I was talking about. This is exactly what I was talking--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: was just checking up on her. I knew she didn't want to see me. I was being polite.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thief. (CONTINUED)

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was he good?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the big deal? She's just some brilliant, pissed-off ex- girlfriend who's dad taught her every trick in the book.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's passionate.

direction.raw_text: She's unbalanced.

direction.raw_text: Her job is very stressful.

direction.raw_text: She could reduce her stress by leaving us alone.

direction.raw_text: I don't have twenty-four hours. They're there now. They'll lead me to him.

direction.raw_text: Yes.

direction.raw_text: Thanks for trying.

direction.raw_text: Let's share a car.

direction.raw_text: That would be nice. Thank you.

direction.raw_text: : 63. 89   INT. MONTE CARLO CASINO -- NIGHT                            89 Dinner Jacket (AKA FRANCOIS TOULOUR) wins a huge blackjack bet. The crowd reacts enthusiastically. direction.raw_text: All in all, it was depressingly familiar. The forced camaraderie, the hollow smiles. Scared to take a moment's reflection. Scared to imagine a different life. We behaved like boys. (beat, he chokes) But... (CONTINUED)
